intro: Mauduita, commonly known as the desert star, is a flowering plant native to arid regions of the Americas. It belongs to the Apocynaceae family and is characterized by its succulent, fleshy leaves and showy, star-shaped flowers. The plant is adapted to survive in harsh, dry environments, storing water in its thick stems and leaves. It produces small, capsule-like fruits that contain seeds dispersed by wind. Mauduita is often used in traditional medicine for its purported healing properties.
